items.title: Revealed: The travel hotspots Australians are heading to this summer
items.summary: Almost three-quarters of Australians will be heading on holiday this summer — but many are choosing to stay closer to home.

items.title: 'Force of arms': Putin makes strong Donbas threat, adding pressure on peace deal
items.summary: Putin's territorial demand is something that Ukraine has never given any indication it would accept.

items.title: The latest travel advice for Southeast Asia amid deadly storms, floods affecting millions
items.summary: Travel warnings remain in place for parts of Asia where locals say they have "lost it all" as they take stock of the damage.

items.title: 'Worst job in politics': Vincent Tarzia steps down as South Australia's Opposition leader
items.summary: Tarzia is the third state Liberal to lose the leadership in as many weeks.

items.title: What we know about the Trump-brokered DR Congo–Rwanda peace deal
items.summary: Rwanda and the Democratic Republic of Congo have signed a US-brokered peace accord aimed at ending the long-running conflict in eastern DRC.

items.title: Border Force detains six Chinese men who arrived in remote WA community by boat
items.summary: Western Australia police said an off-duty officer located two men 12km north of Kalumburu on Monday.

items.title: Should adults opt in to switch off their social media algorithm, as kids get banned?
items.summary: Ahead of the under-16s social media ban, activists have urged the government to introduce an opt-in feature for social media algorithms.

items.title: Australia's 'mateship' package for Ukraine praised but questions remain on sanctions
items.summary: The latest $95 million package includes funds for military procurement and targeted sanctions on an additional 45 Russian "shadow fleet" vessels

items.title: Who could the Socceroos play? What to know about the FIFA World Cup 2026 draw
items.summary: The FIFA World Cup 2026 draw will reveal who will play who as well as .... FIFA's inaugural peace prize winner.

items.title: How much super will you need? The new figure to retire comfortably
items.summary: Bucket list trips? Streaming subscriptions? Here's how much you'll need to retire comfortably, according to an industry peak body.

items.title: What Australians now expect from landlords
items.summary: As new minimum standards start to gain traction, so too are expectations that landlords — at least in part — cover the cost of meeting them.

items.title: 350 Australians a day: What happens to those on the edge of a housing crisis
items.summary: More Australians at risk of homelessness are being turned away as frontline services buckle under worsening housing and safety pressures.

items.title: Alleged childcare abuser hit with 83 more charges by police
items.summary: Joshua Dale Brown has been charged with a raft of fresh child sex abuse offences after a slew of allegations led parents to test their children for diseases.

items.title: Nearly 44,000 Australians are owed Centrelink refunds. Some died without knowing
items.summary: Services Australia told SBS News they've refunded $2.9 million to just 338 of the 44,000 people potentially owed money.

items.title: 'We're looking at it very seriously': Trump eyes Australia's superannuation scheme
items.summary: Trump says his administration is considering an Australian-style superannuation system, but it's not clear how the policy would be adopted.

items.title: Hamas hands over remains believed to be one of Gaza's last hostages
items.summary: Israel has received a body that Hamas says is one of the last two deceased hostages remaining in Gaza, pending forensic identification.

items.title: Brittany Higgins 'can breathe again' as Bruce Lehrmann loses defamation appeal
items.summary: Brittany Higgins has welcomed the Federal Court's decision to uphold a defamation ruling against Bruce Lehrmann.

items.title: Sara's partner, brother and father are Australian citizens. But she can never be one
items.summary: A group of around 900 asylum seekers who came to Australia by boat nearly 13 years ago remain stuck in visa limbo, fighting for permanency.

items.title: Four Indigenous renters have won their High Court case against the NT gov's 'Remote Rent Framework'
items.summary: The four plaintiffs from remote communities across the Territory fought a 'David and Goliath' battle against rental increases.

items.title: What 16,000 Australians reveal about the hidden realities of working from home
items.summary: Does working from home really boost wellbeing — and does one gender benefit more? Here's what new research suggests.

items.title: ‘Innocent Aussie kids’: The risky escape route these detained Australians can't follow
items.summary: The US wants countries to repatriate its detained citizens from Syria. But Australia's government insists it’s "not" doing that.

items.title: More than 1,300 killed in floods across Asia, as deforestation partly blamed for disaster
items.summary: Rescuers have struggled to access some villages on the Indonesian island of Sumatra after roads were washed out and bridges collapsed.

items.title: eSafety commissioner hits back at US politician's 'zealot for global takedowns' claim
items.summary: eSafety commissioner Julie Inman Grant said she would be sending a letter "explaining a few things" to US politician Jim Jordan.

items.title: US and Russia fail to reach compromise on Ukraine following talks at the Kremlin
items.summary: US negotiators met Russian President Vladimir Putin in Moscow to present a revised peace plan aimed at ending the war in Ukraine.
